#Text=Inside the Sphere
#Text=" Go on , " said Cavor , as I sat across the edge of the manhole , and looked down into the black interior of the sphere .
#Text=We two were alone .
#Text=It was evening , the sun had set , and the stillness of the twilight was upon everything .
#Text=I drew my other leg inside and slid down the smooth glass to the bottom of the sphere , then turned to take the cans of food and other impedimenta from Cavor .
#Text=The interior was warm , the thermometer stood at eighty , and as we should lose little or none of this by radiation , we were dressed in shoes and thin flannels .
#Text=We had , however , a bundle of thick woollen clothing and several thick blankets to guard against mischance .
#Text=By Cavor 's direction I placed the packages , the cylinders of oxygen , and so forth , loosely about my feet , and soon we had everything in .
#Text=He walked about the roofless shed for a time seeking anything we had overlooked , and then crawled in after me .
#Text=I noted something in his hand .
#Text=" What have you got there ? " I asked .
#Text=" Have n't you brought anything to read ? "
#Text=" Good Lord !

#Text=There are uncertainties -- The voyage may last -- We may be weeks !

column1: #Text=" We shall be floating in this sphere with absolutely no occupation . "
#Text=" I wish I 'd known -- "
#Text=He peered out of the manhole .
#Text=" Look ! " he said .
#Text=" There 's something there ! "
#Text=" Is there time ? "
#Text=" We shall be an hour . "
#Text=I looked out .
#Text=It was an old number of Tit-Bits that one of the men must have brought .
#Text=Farther away in the corner I saw a torn Lloyd 's News .
#Text=I scrambled back into the sphere with these things .
#Text=" What have you got ? " I said .
#Text=I took the book from his hand and read , " The Works of William Shakespeare " .
#Text=He coloured slightly .
#Text=" My education has been so purely scientific -- " he said apologetically .
#Text=" Never read him ? "
#Text=" Never . "
#Text=" He knew a little , you know -- in an irregular sort of way . "
#Text=" Precisely what I am told , " said Cavor .
#Text=I assisted him to screw in the glass cover of the manhole , and then he pressed a stud to close the corresponding blind in the outer case .
#Text=The little oblong of twilight vanished .
#Text=We were in darkness .
#Text=For a time neither of us spoke .
#Text=Although our case would not be impervious to sound , everything was very still .
#Text=I perceived there was nothing to grip when the shock of our start should come , and I realised that I should be uncomfortable for want of a chair .
#Text=" Why have we no chairs ? " I asked .
#Text=" I 've settled all that , " said Cavor .
#Text=" We wo n't need them . "
#Text=" Why not ? "
#Text=" You will see , " he said , in the tone of a man who refuses to talk .
#Text=I became silent .
#Text=Suddenly it had come to me clear and vivid that I was a fool to be inside that sphere .
#Text=Even now , I asked myself , is to too late to withdraw ?

#Text=The world outside the sphere , I knew , would be cold and inhospitable enough for me -- for weeks I had been living on subsidies from Cavor -- but after all , would it be as cold as the infinite zero , as inhospitable as empty space ?
#Text=If it had not been for the appearance of cowardice , I believe that even then I should have made him let me out .
#Text=But I hesitated on that score , and hesitated , and grew fretful and angry , and the time passed .
#Text=There came a little jerk , a noise like champagne being uncorked in another room , and a faint whistling sound .
#Text=For just one instant I had a sense of enormous tension , a transient conviction that my feet were pressing downward with a force of countless tons .
#Text=It lasted for an infinitesimal time .
#Text=But it stirred me to action .
#Text=" Cavor ! " I said into the darkness , " my nerve 's in rags .

#Text=Already we are flying as swiftly as a bullet up into the gulf of space .

_	_	_	_

#Text= I -- " I said , and then it did n't seem to matter what happened .

column1: #Text=For a time I was , as it were , stunned ; I had nothing to say .
#Text=It was just as if I had never heard of this idea of leaving the world before .
#Text=Then I perceived an unaccountable change in my bodily sensations .
#Text=It was a feeling of lightness , of unreality .
#Text=Coupled with that was a queer sensation in the head , an apoplectic effect almost , and a thumping of blood vessels at the ears .
#Text=Neither of these feelings diminished as time went on , but at last I got so used to them that I experienced no inconvenience .
#Text=I heard a click , and a little glow lamp came into being .
#Text=I saw Cavor 's face , as white as I felt my own to be .
#Text=We regarded one another in silence .
#Text=The transparent blackness of the glass behind him made him seem as though he floated in a void .
#Text=" Well , we 're committed , " I said at last .
#Text=" Yes , " he said , " we 're committed . "
#Text=" Do n't move , " he exclaimed , at some suggestion of a gesture .
#Text=" Let your muscles keep quite lax -- as if you were in bed .
